content.title: Bowel Viability Assessment
content.definition: Clinical and adjunctive methods to determine whether intestine will survive and function following ischemia, guiding decisions about resection versus preservation.

doppler_ultrasound.technique: Continuous wave or duplex over mesentery
doppler_ultrasound.finding: Arterial signals in mesenteric arcade and bowel wall

fluorescein.technique: IV fluorescein (15 mg/kg) with Wood's lamp
fluorescein.limitations: Requires darkened OR, not always available

pitfalls: Mucosal ischemia may exist despite normal serosa
content.statement: Bowel Viability Assessment is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric-Ischemia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Bowel Viability Assessment helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Bowel Viability Assessment include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Bowel Viability Assessment.

learning_objectives: Describe clinical signs of bowel viability
Apply viability assessment to resection decisions
clinical_pearls: When in doubt, preserve and second-look
ICG is replacing fluorescein in many centers
